snippet: Because economists had expected a 0.5 percent rise in inventories at wholesalers, they now expect that the government will cut its fourth-quarter growth estimate.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that wholesale inventories only increased 0.3 percent after a 0.5 percent gain in November, raising expectations that the government will cut its estimate of fourth-quarter growth.
lead_paragraph: Because economists had expected a 0.5 percent rise in inventories at wholesalers, they now expect that the government will cut its fourth-quarter growth estimate.

headline.main: Wholesale Inventory Data For December Fell Short
headline.print_headline: Wholesale Inventory Data for December Fell Short
